description: A medical device that supports or takes over breathing for patients with respiratory failure.
A diagnostic tool that uses radiation to create images of bones and internal structures.
A life-saving device that delivers electric shocks to restore normal heart rhythms in cardiac arrest patients.
A mobility aid designed to assist patients with limited or no ability to walk.
An adjustable bed designed for patient care, enhancing comfort and accessibility in medical settings.
A device that records the heart’s electrical activity to detect irregularities and cardiac conditions.
An imaging system that uses magnetic fields and radio waves to create detailed images of internal organs.
A device that precisely delivers fluids, medications, or nutrients into a patient’s bloodstream.
Protective hand coverings used by medical staff to maintain hygiene and prevent contamination.
A method of delivering fluids, nutrients, or medications directly into a patient's veins.
A disposable face mask that protects against airborne contaminants and reduces infection spread.
A protective garment worn by medical staff to prevent contamination and ensure a sterile environment.
A transparent protective visor that guards against splashes, droplets, and airborne particles.
A medical instrument used to inject or withdraw fluids from the body.
Sterile materials used to cover wounds and promote healing while preventing infections.
Special containers designed for the collection, storage, and transfusion of blood.
A liquid disinfectant used to cleanse wounds and prevent infections.
Soft, absorbent materials used in medical applications for wound care and cleaning.
